channel.title: Post your professional tips and secrets here
channel.description: Everyone know some secrets or tips. So post your best here.Creating music with Auxy is fun,but with secrets and new sounds created by YOU in Auxy,that's even better than fun! I hope you will post some ideas about sounds and even more!

item.title: Post your professional tips and secrets here
item.dc:creator: Polar
item.description:
When in an argument, always listen to the other side before you make your side. Talking over eachother can cause cluster, no one will hear anything, everyone will continue to be stubborn, and it just makes people more furious.

Read full topic

item.title: Post your professional tips and secrets here
item.dc:creator: RazerFireRiot
item.description:
To make the good track, it’s all in these layers
Lead synth
Support synth lead
Background synth
Bass
Bass support (optional)
And a sick drum beat

Read full topic

item.title: Post your professional tips and secrets here
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
Hardly a professional secret, but filtering out the hidden frequencies from your sounds goes along way to preventing muddy mixes.

ie: a low pass filter on your bassline or a high pass on your hats.

Read full topic

item.title: Post your professional tips and secrets here
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
I posted this in the Post writing and production tips (links & embeds only) thread but I think it’s worth posting again for those that missed it.

The pink noise mixing technique takes about 5 minutes to learn and can greatly improve your final mixdown.

https://www.youtube.com/embed/dUaok-7-2L4

https://www.youtube.com/embed/EerIGRBoIzw

Read full topic

item.title: Post your professional tips and secrets here
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
Well I’m not professional but here is a random thing I do that may help…Once I finish a song, I change the key a billion times to figure out what sounds the best. Each key is totally different and sounds awesome Lol. ( My favs are probably E and A)

Read full topic
